Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: blitz
Description: Blitz.js CLI is your single access point for interacting with your app, from database management to code generation

Arguments.Name: seed
Arguments.Description: Generates seeded data in database via Prisma 2. You need db/seeds.ts or db/seeds/index.ts

Arguments.Name: --no-incremental-build
Arguments.Description: Disable incremental build and start from a fresh cache

Arguments.Name: generate
Arguments.Description: Generate new files for your Blitz project

Arguments.Name: -c
Arguments.Description: Provide a context folder within which we'll place the generated files for better code organization. You can also supply this in the name of the model to be generated (e.g. `blitz generate query admin/projects`). Combining the `--context` flags and supplying context via the model name in the same command is not supported

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Specify a parent model to be used for generating nested routes for dependent data when generating pages, or to create hierarchical validation in queries and mutations. The code will be generated with the nested data model in mind. Most often this should be used in conjunction with 'blitz generate all'

Arguments.Name: -d
Arguments.Description: Show what files will be created without writing them to disk

Arguments.Name: install
Arguments.Description: Install a Recipe into your Blitz app

Arguments.Name: --npm
Arguments.Description: Use npm as the package manager

Arguments.Name: --yarn
Arguments.Description: Use yarn as the package manager

Arguments.Name: -d
Arguments.Description: Show what files will be created without writing them to disk

Arguments.Name: prisma
Arguments.Description: Loads env variables then proxies all args to Prisma CLI

Arguments.Name: --datasource-provider
Arguments.Description: Define the datasource provider to use

Arguments.Name: --schema
Arguments.Description: Custom path to your Prisma schema

Arguments.Name: --data-proxy
Arguments.Description: Enable the Data Proxy in the Prisma Client

Arguments.Name: --no-hints
Arguments.Description: Hides the hint messages but still outputs errors and warnings

Arguments.Name: --no-engine
Arguments.Description: Generate a client for use with Accelerate only

Arguments.Name: --watch
Arguments.Description: Watch the Prisma schema and rerun after a change

Arguments.Name: --allow-no-models
Arguments.Description: Allow generating a client without models

Arguments.Name: --schema
Arguments.Description: Custom path to your Prisma schema

Arguments.Name: -n
Arguments.Description: Hostname to bind the Express server to

Arguments.Name: --schema
Arguments.Description: Custom path to your Prisma schema

Arguments.Name: dev
Arguments.Description: The migrate dev command updates your database using migrations files during development

Arguments.Name: --schema
Arguments.Description: Custom path to your Prisma schema

Arguments.Name: --create-only
Arguments.Description: Create a new migration but do not apply it. The migration will be empty if there are no changes in Prisma schema

Arguments.Name: -n
Arguments.Description: The name of the migration. If no name is provided, the CLI will prompt you

Arguments.Name: reset
Arguments.Description: Reset your database and apply all migrations, all data will be lost

Arguments.Name: --schema
Arguments.Description: Custom path to your Prisma schema

Arguments.Name: deploy
Arguments.Description: Apply pending migrations to update the database schema in production/staging

Arguments.Name: --schema
Arguments.Description: Custom path to your Prisma schema

Arguments.Name: resolve
Arguments.Description: Resolve issues with database migrations in deployment databases

Arguments.Name: --schema
Arguments.Description: Custom path to your Prisma schema

Arguments.Name: --applied
Arguments.Description: Record a specific migration as applied

Arguments.Name: --rolled-back
Arguments.Description: Record a specific migration as rolled back

Arguments.Name: status
Arguments.Description: Check the status of your database migrations

Arguments.Name: --schema
Arguments.Description: Custom path to your Prisma schema

Arguments.Name: diff
Arguments.Description: Compares the database schema from two arbitrary sources, and outputs the differences either as a human-readable summary (by default) or an executable script

Arguments.Name: --from-empty
Arguments.Description: Flag to assume from is an empty datamodel

Arguments.Name: --to-empty
Arguments.Description: Flag to assume to is an empty datamodel

Arguments.Name: --from-schema-datamodel
Arguments.Description: Path to a Prisma schema file, uses the 'datamodel' for the diff

Arguments.Name: --to-schema-datamodel
Arguments.Description: Path to a Prisma schema file, uses the 'datamodel' for the diff

Arguments.Name: --from-schema-datasource
Arguments.Description: Path to a Prisma schema file, uses the 'datasource url' for the diff

Arguments.Name: --to-schema-datasource
Arguments.Description: Path to a Prisma schema file, uses the 'datasource url' for the diff

Arguments.Name: --from-migrations
Arguments.Description: Path to the Prisma Migrate migrations directory

Arguments.Name: --to-migrations
Arguments.Description: Path to the Prisma Migrate migrations directory

Arguments.Name: --shadow-database-url
Arguments.Description: URL for the shadow database. Only required if using --from-migrations or --to-migrations

Arguments.Name: --script
Arguments.Description: Render a SQL script to stdout instead of the default human readable summary (not supported on MongoDB)

Arguments.Name: --exit-code
Arguments.Description: Change the exit code behavior to signal if the diff is empty or not (Empty: 0, Error: 1, Not empty: 2). Default behavior is Success: 0, Error: 1.`

Arguments.Name: db
Arguments.Description: Manage your database schema and lifecycle (Preview)

Arguments.Name: --schema
Arguments.Description: Custom path to your Prisma schema

Arguments.Name: --print
Arguments.Description: Print the introspected Prisma schema to stdout

Arguments.Name: --composite-type-depth
Arguments.Description: Specify the depth for introspecting composite types (e.g. Embedded Documents in MongoDB). Number, default is -1 for infinite depth, 0 = off

Arguments.Name: push
Arguments.Description: This command pushes the state of your Prisma schema file to the database without using migrations files

Arguments.Name: --schema
Arguments.Description: Custom path to your Prisma schema

Arguments.Name: --skip-generate
Arguments.Description: Skip generation of artifacts such as Prisma Client

Arguments.Name: --force-reset
Arguments.Description: Resets the database and then updates the schema - useful if you need to start from scratch due to unexecutable migrations

Arguments.Name: --accept-data-loss
Arguments.Description: Ignore data loss warnings. This option is required if as a result of making the schema changes, data may be lost

Arguments.Name: --schema
Arguments.Description: Custom path to your Prisma schema

Arguments.Name: execute
Arguments.Description: Execute native commands to your database

Arguments.Name: --schema
Arguments.Description: Custom path to your Prisma schema

Arguments.Name: --file
Arguments.Description: Path to a file. The content will be sent as the script to be executed

Arguments.Name: --stdin
Arguments.Description: Use the terminal standard input as the script to be executed

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: Print current version of Prisma components
